title: honouring opponents - is this gone for good? And single target honour - any AOE honour coming?
body:
Sometimes there is mad bantz or encouragement from the other team that the old system allowed distribution of honour but this is gone - any plan to bring this back?

Also, what if more than one of my team mates deserves honour? Sometimes the synergy is real and the bantz are mad and one honour just isnt enough.

Any tweaks to the honour system incoming?

replies.body:
The mentioned when they released it that they're working on opponent honouring. So we ought to get it in the next few months, or so.

Also, the reason the single person vote instead of multiple people is so that honours are worth more. If you willy-nilly hand out 9 honours a game, those aren't worth anything.

i feel we should have been given honour credits to use or something though. Some games, there is nobody I want to honour, some games I want to honour my entire (or maybe both) teams. I understand rationing honour to try to standardise it's worth but it devalues the intention of the honour system in the first place.

I think this system is good at getting players to acknowledge each other when they normally wouldn't.  How often did you hand out honour when you got flogged by the opposition?  Personally, when that happens now and I see my team mates faces right there after the defeat screen instead of going straight to the lobby to hear an onslaught of "gg ez, noobs," I can really stop and assess the game. That person on my team was a great shotcaller or this person stayed focused on the winning for the entirety of the game, etc.  It's nice to come out of a game with something positive to say.

I understand rationing honour to try to standardise it's worth but it devalues the intention of the honour system in the first place.

Great points. I like this idea a lot, as there are plenty of games where I don't honour anyone (or would honour opponents if I could). But I also get games where the are friendly, tactical, smart, skilled etc. teammates that I want to give multiple people credit. I honestly don't see how giving summoners the option to bank honour from mediocre games and distribute it to multiple people in future games would harm or devalue the honour system.

If you accumulate 1 honour per game then just let it cap out at 10 over 10 games if you don't honour anyone for the previous 9. Or if you like more logic but less nice round numbers, just make it cap out at 9, since you could only ever potentially honour 9 players in the one game.
